definition: Yang Yuhuan 楊玉環|杨玉环[Yang2 Yu4 huan2] or Yang Guifei (719-756), famous Tang beauty, consort of Emperor Xuanzhong 唐玄宗[Tang2 Xuan2 zong1], blamed for extravagance and killed as a scapegoat during the An-Shi Rebellion 安史之亂|安史之乱[An1 Shi3 zhi1 Luan4]
poplar
surname Yang
expensive/noble/precious/(honorific) your
imperial concubine

sentences.english: Yang Guifei was a real national beauty.
Tang prepares a small feast for Yang in the imperial garden.
sentences.chinese: 唐明皇在御花园中为杨贵妃设下小宴。

sentences.english: This site used to be the private baths for Yang Guifei, favorite concubine of the Tang emperor.
sentences.chinese: 您还可以到杨贵妃洗澡的华清池去洗温泉澡。

sentences.english: Yang Guifei liked the sweet litchis very much.
sentences.chinese: 美味的荔枝深得杨贵妃的喜爱。

sentences.english: Without any other choice, Yang hangs herself on a pear tree.
sentences.chinese: 无奈之下，杨贵妃自缢于梨花树下。

sentences.english: He once presented litchis from here as a tribute to Emperor Tang Xuanzong's concubine, Yang Guifei.
sentences.chinese: 他曾经把这里的荔枝进贡给唐玄宗的妃子杨贵妃吃。

sentences.english: Concubine Yang was Emperor Xuanzong's favorite concubine in the Tang Dynasty and she was also one of Four Great Beauties in ancient China.
sentences.chinese: 杨贵妃是唐玄宗皇帝的爱妃，也是中国四大美人之一。

sentences.english: The high-ranking Imperial Concubine Yang was a plump beauty in Tang Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 杨贵妃的体态充盈，是个唐代的美人。

sentences.english: Since Emperor Tang does not return to the palace, beauty Yang becomes angry and drinks her sorrows away.
sentences.chinese: 杨贵妃因唐明皇夜不回宫，心底生怨，借酒浇愁。

sentences.english: Women chubby beauty was adored in ancient Tang Dynasty in China, and the typical girl was Yang Guifei.
sentences.chinese: 中国唐朝崇尚丰膄婀娜之美，以杨贵妃为典型。

sentences.english: Now many people are in doubt , it really is so beautiful legend?
sentences.chinese: 现在许多人都在怀疑，杨贵妃真有传说中那么美么？

sentences.english: Yang Guifei , originally named Yang Yuhuan, was one of the Four Beauties in ancient China.
sentences.chinese: 杨贵妃，小名玉环，中国古代四大美人之一。

sentences.english: In ancient times, the most famous beautiful lady was also a fat one, the royal concubine Yang.
sentences.chinese: 古代呢，最出名的美女还是大胖子，杨贵妃啊。

sentences.english: Their performances bedazzle those audiences, and it seems that beauty Yang and An Lushan have become the key figures.
sentences.chinese: 俨然杨贵妃和安禄山已变成了核心人物。

definition: Emperor Ming of Tang (685-762), also known as Emperor Xuanzong of Tang 唐玄宗[Tang2 Xuan2 zong1], reigned 712-756
Tang Emperor Xuanzong (685-762), also known as Emperor Ming of Tang 唐明皇[Tang2 Ming2 huang2], reign name of seventh Tang emperor 李隆基[Li3 Long1 ji1], reigned 712-756
senior concubine/imperial consort

Yang Yuhuan or Yang Guifei 楊貴妃|杨贵妃[Yang2 Gui4 fei1] (719-756), famous Tang beauty, consort of Emperor Xuanzhong 唐玄宗[Tang2 Xuan2 zong1], blamed for extravagance and killed as a scapegoat during the An-Shi Rebellion 安史之亂|安史之乱[An1 Shi3 zhi1 Luan4]
see 楊貴妃|杨贵妃[Yang2 Gui4 fei1]
Wu Zetian (624-705), Tang empress, reigned 690-705
personal name of seventh Tang emperor Xuanzong 唐玄宗[Tang2 Xuan2 zong1] (685-762), reigned 712-756
Princess Taiping (c. 665-713), Tang Dynasty princess, politically powerful and known for her beauty
Bai Juyi (772-846), Tang dynasty poet
Emperor Taizong of Tang, reign name of second Tang emperor Li Shimin 李世民[Li3 Shi4 min2] (599-649), reigned 626-649
Tang dynasty (618-907)
An Lushan (703-757), Tang general, leader of the An-Shi Rebellion 安史之亂|安史之乱[An1 Shi3 zhi1 Luan4]
imperial concubine
Emperor Suzong of Tang (711-762), reign name of eighth Tang emperor Li Heng 李亨[Li3 Heng1], reigned 756-762
empress/imperial consort
Zhang Yizhi (-705), Tang dynasty politician and favorite of Empress Wu Zetian 武則天|武则天[Wu3 Ze2 tian1]
